ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Practice basic drawing, watercolor techniques + knowledge (a bit of basic color theory, intention, highlights / shadows)

An overview of the history of watercolor, with a wide variety of artists throughout a large time range

In this course, we briefly learned about a handful of very famous watercolorists and spent the majority of our time practicing with the medium.  It was interesting to learn some history and enjoyable to make work ourselves!

I learned so many artistic skills from this class. Before I took this class, I had really never drawn or painted. That being said, some of my paintings started off rough. But throughout the semester, I learned basic drawing technique, different watercolor techniques, how to develop color, and how to push myself out of my comfort zone.
Basic painting skills, insights about various styles that painters have used throughout history.
I had never watercolored before so I learned the basics of how to paint. I also learned about the most famous watercolorists in history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Course served as a good compliment to the STEM-heavy workload I otherwise had, was fun to learn how to be expressive and creative
I found the class sessions and homework for this course productive and enjoyable!

The strengths of this course are definitely the resources, the amount of time we get to spend painting, and the feedback we get on our work. All of these elements were important to helping us improve our craft.
Fun to paint. The final essay was like 8-10 pages without clear guidelines/ hard to write that much on such small prompt without much explanation.

Strengths: get to paint outdoors during class periods and Professor Van Doren is hilarious. 
Weaknesses: class is slightly unorganized and sometimes the powerpoints are a little boring.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Highly recommend if you're interested in taking a fun art course

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student! You do not need to have any prior skills in painting or drawing to get a lot out of this class. I recommend taking it during a semester when you have more free time. It is not to say that this course requires a ton of time, but it is a matter of you get out what you put in.
Yes definitely. If you are a new artist, like me, it can be intimidating at first, but this class is so welcoming and you will learn so much.
Yes I would recommend. It was a nice break from my other more rigorous workload.
Yes definitely - this class was wonderful. Such a needed break from academic classes and so much fun to practice a new skill!
